name: places/ChIJt4TrE_1YwokRVedrKxaqYoo
formattedAddress: 511 Lexington Avenue At, E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 511 Lexington Avenue At, E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

editorialSummary.text: Warm, traditional hotel with modern rooms & suites, plus a lively cocktail bar & a coffee shop.

originalText.text:
Thanks to Brian and the Lexington Hotel Staff for making our New Years Eve experience memorable. For starters, the check in experience was a breeze. We arrived a bit early and our room was available. (Much appreciated after our 6 hour flight!!).  The lobby was clean and welcoming and we immediately noticed the plush and cozy bar in the lobby.  (We came a bit later in the evening and the drinks were fancy and perfect for entertaining guests…which we did).

Our room was IMMACULATE.  Wow!  Our suite was beautifully decorated and the water pressure in the shower was amazing!

The bed was comfortable, the sheets were cozy and we overslept every day…happily :)

And to top it off, there was a DJ spinning in the lobby and complimentary champagne at midnight for the balldrop!  So classy!

Every time we needed something…even if it was a restaurant recommendation…the staff was always eager to help us make our stay more enjoyable.

I can’t say enough about this hotel.  Will definitely be back soon!

originalText.text:
The location it perfect for walking around or get ride (train, cab, Uber) to another part of town. The hotel looks nice from the outside but the amenities inside aren't the best.

The rooms are very small, did I say small, very small. But if you're not spending a lot of time in them, you're good.

The front staff, to give 2 cares about you, your stay, or your status with Marriott. They weren't very friendly. The staff up on the floor, very friendly and nice. They are why service gets 2 stars.

Our first night the restaurant was closed, and it seems to be a theme from reading the other reviews. The breakfast is a joke, might as well be a Springhill suites.

Overall this place shouldn't be an autograph hotel, it lacks the service and atmosphere. Don't get me wrong, it looks very nice.

The rooms are way to small and the bathroom is even smaller.

I would come back just because of the location but that's it

originalText.text:
Been staying at this hotel for some years now and I totally recommend the staff namely Nicole at front desk and her amazing colleagues alongside the manager Alan! But this time my review is mainly about the housekeeping team. My room was recently cleaned by Tenzin, the Housekeeper at Lexington autograph hotel. And she has to be the best housekeeper in the entire building! My goodness, good people skills and impeccable work as well. I am extremely impressed with her work and I believe she is a true gem to the house keeping unit in this hotel.
She treated me with respect, love, great energy and I felt right at home as she cleaned whilst I stayed in the room.
If there is one thing I can remember is her attention to detail and going the extra mile for guests for things I didn’t even know I needed. Thank you so much TENZIN! Thank you so much Ellen for leading a winning team’

originalText.text: A solid choice for hotels.  Close enough to the sites but not in the crush of Times Square.   Service is very accommodating though the Guest Service hotline went to voice mail. And they took quite a bit of time to answer chats on the app.   The standard rooms are quite small and with the smaller windows of old can seem even smaller.  The upgraded rooms are decent size.   Climate control seemed to have two settings, hot and cold.  The hotel needs to invest in new pillows.

text.text: A solid choice for hotels.  Close enough to the sites but not in the crush of Times Square.   Service is very accommodating though the Guest Service hotline went to voice mail. And they took quite a bit of time to answer chats on the app.   The standard rooms are quite small and with the smaller windows of old can seem even smaller.  The upgraded rooms are decent size.   Climate control seemed to have two settings, hot and cold.  The hotel needs to invest in new pillows.

originalText.text: Great location, staff was great too. But room was slightly dirty, sheets were not soft at all, my husband and I woke up very stuffy. They didn’t accommodate any towel requests I put in through the Marriott app. And the continental breakfast is NOT free like every other hotel I have stayed with. They will charge you about $35 per person for a dingy breakfast setup when we should have just went to Starbucks right next door and paid $10 a person. And god forbid it takes you an extra second to get out of a breakfast staff’s way they will yell at you to move and then tell you to GTF out of her city.
